user_auth.forms module

class user_auth.forms.UserRegistrationForm(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: UserCreationForm

Custom User Registration Form that extends Django’s UserCreationForm.

Parameters:

  • first_name (django.forms.CharField) – CharField representing the first name of the user.

  • last_name (django.forms.CharField) – CharField representing the last name of the user.

  • email (django.forms.EmailField) – EmailField representing the email address of the user.

Returns:

A form to register a new user with fields for username, first name, last name, email, password1, and password2.

Return type:

django.forms.ModelForm

class Meta[source]

Bases: object

Meta class to define the model and fields for the UserRegistrationForm.

Parameters:

  • model (django.contrib.auth.models.User) – User model to use for registration.

  • fields (list) – List of fields to include in the form.

fields = ['username', 'first_name', 'last_name', 'email', 'password1', 'password2']
model

alias of User

base_fields = {'email': <django.forms.fields.EmailField object>, 'first_name': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'last_name': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'password1': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'password2': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'username': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>}

user_auth.urls module

user_auth.views module

user_auth.views.authenticate_user(request)[source]

View function to authenticate a user and log them in.

Parameters:

request (django.http.HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object representing the incoming request from the user. This should be a POST request containing the user’s username and password.

Returns:

HttpResponse object representing the response to redirect the user to the ‘login’ page if the authentication fails, or redirect them to the ‘home’ page if the authentication is successful.

Return type:

django.http.HttpResponse

user_auth.views.register_user(request)[source]

View function to handle user registration.

Parameters:

request (django.http.HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object representing the incoming request from the user. This can be a GET request to load the registration page or a POST request to submit the registration form.

Returns:

HttpResponse object representing the response to redirect the user to the ‘login’ page after successful registration, or render the ‘registration/register.html’ template with the user registration form for GET requests.

Return type:

django.http.HttpResponse
